Title.En: Exploring Catalonia: An introduction to its language and culture

Description.En:
This course will provide to students basic knowledge of Catalan and Spanish languages and their cultures. The main objective is to enables students to understand and use everyday expressions of very frequent use and simple sentences aimed at satisfying immediate needs. It will also introduce them to some key aspects of the Catalan and Spanish cultures.  

The linguistic and cultural background of students is used as the ground to build upon and to maximize their learning. They will work using a communicative and challenge-based learning methodology. 

This course is not intended for students who have lived in Catalonia, even for a short period. It focuses on discovering the basics and essence of the culture. Therefore, if you have lived there, we do not recommend enrolling

NoteLiteral.En: At the end of the course students will be able to understand and use everyday expressions and simple statements to satisfy specific needs.

Title.En: Recognize aspects of Catalan and Spanish cultures

NoteLiteral.En: At the end of the course students will have gained knowledge about aspects of the Spanish and Catalan cultures.
At the end of the course learners will have increased their intercultural competence abilities and their degree of linguistic awareness.

MoreInformation.NoteLiteral:
There will be **10 on-line synchronous sessions** scheduled each **Thursday** from **15h till 16h from October 3 until December 5.**

The course requires learners to work autonomously outside the classroom by consulting recommended resources and preparing activities aimed at understanding and producing short and simple texts in Catalan and Spanish. The course allows those who attend 75% of the established video conference hours to obtain a certificate of attendance.

This introductory course offered by the UAB language service will enable students to understand and use frequently used everyday expressions and simple sentences aimed at satisfying immediate needs at a beginners level. It will also introduce international students to the Spanish and Catalan cultures.  

If you are planning to visit Catalonia and/or a short mobility internship in the region, this micro module is for you!

**Entry requirements:**

- being affiliated with one of the 14 ECIU university members
- at least 60 ECTS completed at the undergraduate level
- B2 level of English language proficiency.

No previous knowledge of Catalan or Spanish required.

You will receive information about the status of your application within 7 days after the application deadline at latest. If admitted, you will receive instructions regarding the course by the host university.  

**All applicants are required to submit**:

- Recent CV
- Transcript of records
- Motivation letter (250 words max.)
- Document with the following information:
    - ID picture
    - Nationality
    - Date of birth
    - City of birth
    - Current address
    - Email
    - Telephone

If you have any other questions please contact us at **eciu.admissions@uab.cat.**
